skill.name: test/build-error
skill.description: Tests error visibility for build step failures
skill.summary: Tests error visibility for build step failures
skill.author: EnactProtocol

security_audit.summary: Static analyzer flagged a potential weak cryptographic pattern in SKILL.md at line 4. Investigation reveals this is a false positive. SKILL.md is a markdown documentation file that cannot contain executable cryptographic code. The pattern match was likely triggered by an innocent word or phrase in the documentation text. No actual security risks detected. Skill is safe for publication.

high_findings.title: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm - FALSE POSITIVE
high_findings.description: Static analyzer detected 'weak cryptographic algorithm' pattern at SKILL.md:4. This is a false positive. SKILL.md is a markdown documentation file containing no executable code. Markdown files cannot implement cryptographic algorithms. The pattern match was triggered by text content in the documentation, not actual crypto code.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: SKILL.md is a 18-line markdown file that only contains documentation. Pattern detection incorrectly flagged documentation text as crypto code. No executable code exists in the skill files.

content.value_statement: Build failures in CI/CD pipelines can be difficult to diagnose without clear error visibility. This skill provides testing capabilities to verify that build step failures are properly surfaced and reported to users for effective debugging.
actual_capabilities: Validates error reporting in CI/CD pipelines
Tests error logging for build failures
limitations: This is a test skill for validating error visibility, not for fixing build errors
Only tests markdown documentation and skill configuration
Does not execute actual build processes
Cannot resolve or fix build errors automatically

use_cases.title: CI/CD Pipeline Testing
use_cases.description: Quality assurance teams use this skill to validate that build tools properly surface error messages when builds fail, ensuring developers receive actionable feedback.

use_cases.title: Build Tool Debugging
use_cases.description: DevOps engineers use this skill to test and verify that their build error reporting systems are functioning correctly and errors are properly logged.

use_cases.title: Error Reporting Validation
use_cases.description: Development teams use this skill to ensure that build failures are clearly visible and not hidden, improving the debugging experience for all team members.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Error Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the test/build-error skill to verify that build step failures are properly visible in the current environment.

prompt_templates.title: CI/CD Error Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use test/build-error to validate that build error messages are being correctly surfaced in our CI/CD pipeline configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Error Message Formatting
prompt_templates.prompt: Run test/build-error to check that build failure messages are properly formatted and contain all necessary debugging information.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Step Build Error Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute test/build-error with verbose logging enabled to trace exactly how build step failures propagate through the system and verify error visibility at each stage.

output_examples.input: Run the build error visibility test
output_examples.output:
Build Error Visibility Test Results:

Test Status: PASSED
Error Visibility: CONFIRMED

Build step failures are properly surfaced with clear error messages that include file paths, line numbers, and error descriptions.

Pipeline Error Reporting Validation:

1. Build Failure Detection: Working
2. Error Message Clarity: High
3. User Notification: Enabled
4. Debug Info Completeness: Complete

All error visibility checks passed successfully.

best_practices: Always verify error visibility after build configuration changes
Test error reporting with multiple failure scenarios
Document expected error message formats for your team
anti_patterns: Do not rely solely on exit codes for build error detection
Avoid hiding build failures behind generic error messages
Do not skip error visibility testing in production environments

faq.question: What does this skill actually do?
faq.answer: This is a test skill that validates error visibility capabilities in build systems. It tests that build failures are properly surfaced with clear error messages.

faq.question: Can this skill fix build errors?
faq.answer: No. This skill only tests and validates error visibility. It does not modify code, fix build issues, or resolve errors.

faq.question: Does this skill run actual builds?
faq.answer: No. This is a lightweight testing skill that validates documentation and configuration. It does not execute full build processes.

faq.question: What should I use instead to fix build errors?
faq.answer: Use your build tool directly (npm, make, docker, etc.) to diagnose and fix actual build issues. This skill only tests the visibility of those errors.

faq.question: How do I interpret the test results?
faq.answer: Results show whether build failures are properly visible with actionable error messages. Look for pass/fail status and error message quality indicators.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to run in production?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only performs read-only validation tests and does not modify any build configurations or execute actual builds.
